companyData: Neuralink is a neurotechnology company that focuses on developing brain-computer interfaces designed to treat neurological disorders.
San Francisco Bay Area, Silicon Valley, West Coast

Neuralink develops implantable brain-computer interface (BCI) systems designed to facilitate direct communication between the human brain and external devices. The company focuses on creating a scalable neural implant that records and transmits brain signals with high precision. Neuralink's primary device, often referred to as a "Link," includes ultra-thin threads that are surgically placed in the brain to monitor neural activity and potentially stimulate it. These devices are intended for applications in medical treatment, such as helping individuals with paralysis regain motor function or communication capabilities. Neuralink also invests in developing robotic surgical systems to perform the implantation procedure with high accuracy and minimal invasiveness. The long-term goal involves enabling broader human-computer symbiosis, including interaction with artificial intelligence systems.
Biotechnology, Hardware, Health Care, Science and Engineering, Software

Cabaletta Bio has adapted clinically-validated and FDA-approved CAR T cell technology to target B cell-mediated autoimmune diseases.
Greater Philadelphia Area, Great Lakes, Northeastern US

Cabaletta Bio is a biopharmaceutical company focused on the discovery and development of cellular therapies for B cell-mediated autoimmune diseases. The company's therapeutic platform produces highly selective autologous chimeric autoantibody receptor (CAAR) T cells that bind and destroy only disease-causing B cells while sparing healthy B cells which are essential for human health. Cabaletta has signed an exclusive licensing agreement and partnership with Penn focused on treating B cell-mediated autoimmune diseases with CAAR T cells. Cabaletta was founded by Dr. Michael Milone, Dr. Aimee Payne and Dr. Steven Nichtberger. Dr. Milone and Dr. Payne are physicians/scientists at Penn and also serve as co-chairs of Cabaletta’s Scientific Advisory Board. The Company’s lead therapeutic program is a potential treatment for a prototypical B cell-mediated autoimmune disease, mucosal pemphigus Vulgaris (mPV). mPV is a rare skin disorder that causes painful blisters and sores on mucous membranes such as the mouth, nose, throat, and genitals, leading to severe and sometimes debilitating and life-altering effects.

Kraken Robotics is a marine technology company engaged in the design and marketing of advanced sensors for Unmanned Underwater Vehicles.

Kraken Robotics is a marine technology company engaged in the design, development, and marketing of advanced sonar and acoustic velocity sensors for Unmanned Underwater Vehicles used in military and commercial applications. Over the last two years, the company has earned a reputation as world leaders in Synthetic Aperture Sonar - a revolutionary underwater imaging technology that dramatically improves seabed surveys by providing ultra-high resolution imagery at superior coverage rates. Kraken’s series of SAS products called AquaPix® leverages nearly two decades of R&D conducted by NATO’s Undersea Research Centre and millions of dollars in funding support from NATO government sponsors. AquaPix® offers comparable performance to existing high-end military systems at less than 20% of the cost. Kraken is currently engaged in various stages of technology validation and teaming agreements with leading laboratories and strategic industry partners including Defence Research and Development Canada, U.S. Navy’s Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA); the UK Ministry of Defence; Northrop Grumman; ECA Robotics and others. Kraken is located in beautiful, Conception Bay South, Newfoundland.

Wandercraft develops autonomous walking exoskeletons designed to restore upright mobility to individuals with walking impairments.
European Union (EU), Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA)

Wandercraft develops autonomous walking exoskeletons and robotic systems designed to restore upright mobility to individuals with walking impairments. The company offers devices such as Atalante X, a hands‑free, self‑balancing exoskeleton used in rehabilitation centers, and a Personal Exoskeleton prototype that leverages AI‑driven balance to support walking in daily life. Their systems incorporate real‑time adaptive gait algorithms and powered joints to facilitate multidirectional movement and support early intensive rehabilitation. Wandercraft collaborates with healthcare institutions and has initiated clinical trials to evaluate safety and effectiveness in managing spinal cord injuries and stroke rehabilitation.

AIM = AI autonomy platform for heavy machinery Scalable earthmoving is not optional. It’s required for our civilization to flourish. Critical materials like copper, iron ore, lithium are in short supply and dangerous to mine. One billion people live less than 10 meters above rising oceans, 1 in 6 people live in areas with significant wildfire risk, 43% of critical infrastructure is in disrepair and will cost $2.6T to fix, and pollution from the Manhattan Project is still being cleaned up with a $300B invoice, food production must increase 60% to feed 2050 population, it will take 757 years to remove mines in Ukraine with traditional methods. What do these problems have in common? One, our civilization does not have a feasible way to address challenges of this magnitude. Two, earthmoving is a key part of the solution. Our commercially deployed autonomy product runs a wide range of existing earthmoving machinery (new, older, large, small, any brand). As a result, our customers run their operations at maximum throughput and safety. The AIM platform unlocks tremendous value across mining, construction, and defense. AIM has been built by world-class engineers who developed cutting-edge products Google, Waymo, Tesla & SpaceX. We bring deep expertise in autonomy, robotics, hardware, and advanced AI deployed at scale.

San Francisco Bay Area, Silicon Valley, West Coast

Skydio is a drone manufacturer that uses artificial intelligence to create flying drones that are used by consumers, enterprises, and government customers. It develops AI-powered drones to deliver the power and flying cameras without the complexity. The company's drones use an array of cameras and proprietary computer vision technology to recognize, avoid objects in real-time, and predict into the future to make intelligent decisions, enabling users by flying themselves through the most demanding tasks or keeping them safe from obstacles when they want to take control. The company's debut drone, the R1, could track a target and film them while avoiding obstacles without any human intervention required. Then the company released the Skydio 2 in 2019, its second drone, cutting off more than half the price while improving it its autonomous tracking and video capabilities. Its flagship product, the X2, is equipped with seven cameras, 100x zoom, night vision, and promises to turn ordinary users into expert pilots thanks to its self-piloting abilities. It is backed by top investors and strategic partners including Andreessen Horowitz, Linse Capital, Next47, IVP, Playground, NVIDIA, and UP.Partners.

PROCEPT BioRobotics is a surgical robotics company that develops water-based robotic systems for prostate surgery.
San Francisco Bay Area, West Coast, Western US

PROCEPT is a commercial-stage surgical robotics company focused on advancing patient care by developing transformative solutions in urology. PROCEPT develops, manufactures and sells the AquaBeam Robotic System, an advanced, image-guided, surgical robotic system for use in minimally-invasive urologic surgery with an initial focus on treating benign prostatic hyperplasia, or BPH. BPH is the most common prostate disease and impacts approximately 40 million men in the United States. PROCEPT designed Aquablation therapy to deliver effective, safe and durable outcomes for males suffering from lower urinary tract symptoms, or LUTS, due to BPH that are independent of prostate size and shape or surgeon experience. PROCEPT has developed a significant and growing body of clinical evidence, which includes nine clinical studies and over 100 peer-reviewed publications, supporting the benefits and clinical advantages of Aquablation therapy.

Karman+ is a space research and technology company that researches space mining, asteroids, and rare earth materials.

Asteroid mining has lived at the intersection of scientific research and popular culture for decades, with as many academic papers published as there are books, TV shows and movies about it. Access to resources, with its finite nature and disparate distribution of resources, plays an essential part in the geopolitical web of power and wealth. It has defined economic growth to such an extent that we have been using them as primary demarcation lines and identifiers in our history, from the stone to bronze and iron age to our current silicon age. But our resources-driven growth faces a massive existential challenge, with climate change, ecosystem degradation and resource depletion demanding a complete reset. Humanity needs to shift global transportation, manufacturing, construction and energy onto a sustainable path. Expanding beyond the Kármán line is where we believe transformative future growth and innovation will be found. Recent missions by NASA (OSIRIS-REx & DART) and JAXA (Hayabusa2) have firmly pushed the idea of using space resources from academic research into commercial opportunity. We believe the Regolith Age, powered by abundant space resources, is an inevitability that we can accelerate.

Greater Philadelphia Area, East Coast, Southern US

iBio develops and offers product applications of its iBioLaunch™ and iBioModulator™ platforms, providing collaborators full support for turn-key implementation of its technology for both proprietary and biosimilar products. The iBioLaunch platform is a proprietary, transformative technology for development and production of biologics using transient gene expression in unmodified green plants. Advantages over other systems include: success with proteins difficult or impossible to produce with other methods; broadly applicable to biologics, including monoclonal antibodies, other therapeutic proteins and vaccines; enables rapid development and validation of modular, scalable, and optionally robotic, multi-product manufacturing facilities; production time measured in weeks instead of months or more. Additional benefits include a practically unlimited surge capacity for remedial action against bioterrorism and pandemic disease; product entry that is unconstrained by traditional process patents, and significantly lower capital and operating costs for comparable production.

Gole Robotics is a Seoul-based technology company pioneering autonomous material transport solutions for the construction industry. Established in 2023, Gole Robotics addresses critical labor shortages and operational inefficiencies on construction sites by developing and deploying advanced autonomous robots capable of self-driving and automated material unloading. Leveraging a proprietary combination of line tracing and SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) technologies, Gole’s robots navigate complex and dynamic construction environments with precision and reliability. These solutions are designed to optimize material logistics, reduce manual handling, and enhance overall site productivity for large-scale commercial and infrastructure projects. Gole Robotics operates on a project-based business model, providing tailored automation services by dispatching both robots and expert engineers directly to client sites. The company has demonstrated rapid execution capabilities, completing pilot deployments with leading construction firms and earning recognition as a CES 2024 Innovation Award honoree for its contributions to construction automation. With a leadership team combining deep expertise in robotics, AI, and large-scale project management, Gole Robotics is positioned for significant growth in global markets where construction automation is increasingly vital. The company is currently preparing to expand its service offerings and develop an integrated software platform to further enhance client value. Bringing together the most advanced hardware technologies & AI techniques in highly customizable, high performance robots.
European Union (EU), Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA)

Adapta Robotics addresses diverse automation scenarios & problems in environments where automation is challenging to be brought & their use cases not addressed by common, existing solutions. The product lines are built on AI solutions & technologies, which come on top of the robots’ core functionalities. Adapta’s portfolio contains two product lines (MATT-the device testing robot- & ERIS-the effective retail intelligent scanner), offering the undeniable advantage of adaptable & easy-to-integrate automation when people & software solutions are inefficient/ insufficient. Both lines incorporate robotics as well as AI & computer vision while adding value through the team’s custom robotics development services. MATT, the smart device testing robot, covers the automation of scenarios throughout the device testing process (touch screens & buttons, but not only) that humans & software solutions can’t solve or handle. MATT solves the need for continuous device testing, enhancing testing automation through physical interaction with devices. It helps manufacturers, developers or solution providers to keep up with the increasing complexity of gadgets, apps, functionalities & updates. MATT & its software ecosystem was designed to be easily scalable & upgraded. Its features make it an ideal solution for testing anywhere from R&D to performance verification, connectivity & end of line testing. By using AI, MATT can perform context awareness and dynamic reactions to events (popups), differentiating &navigating on a UI based on visual cues, or even implementing typical usage scenarios, following user interaction. For MATT, the device testing use cases it performs are as diverse as the industries it is utilized by (automotive, aerospace, medical, R&D, device refurbishment, consumer electronics, smart home appliances). We have built MATT’s capabilities on AI & computer vision; hence the device-testing robot is able to cover a wide range of scenarios: speech & image recognition, icon recognition, OCR, QR & many more. Its abilities are also extending to use cases in industrial environments such as color-coding recognition for picking up products- using suction cups- and storing them in warehouses according to associated color codes; or automatizing the recycling process of tiers scraps by selecting the ones that where color coded to have the adequate chemical composition. ERIS- effective retail intelligent scanning- contributes to the retailer's digitalization by utilizing AI solutions to combat the biggest challenges & support the implementation of automation. ERIS uses AI to solve price & promotion discrepancies (from shelf to cash register) & minimize customer dissatisfaction caused by empty shelves & price tag mistakes. This is achieved by checking the correctness of prices on the shelf, detecting in-store out-of-stock situations, real-time operation, construction of visual maps & panoramic previews, easy-to-use interface & controls (accessible & adaptable: 4g internet connection, light intensity control, computing operator travel speed). The technology behind ERIS is based on AI at the edge, having the capabilities of- including, but not only- price label detection, and product stock detection. The technology behind the robot, the hardware vision modules inside it, the computer vision models & AI algorithms that track stock modifications, price discrepancies, and product placement, can be repurposed to other applications for a wider variety of setups and scenarios related to the retail space. These include fixed camera systems that can track stock changes, automatic hand-held scanners for stores with reduced footprints, and autonomous solutions for tracking inventory and its placement in warehouses for the logistics space. These directions are approachable through the technology that has already been implemented. Underlining our capabilities are the three pillars of Adapta: MATT, ERIS, and custom robotics services. These pillars leverage our in-house developed and real-life validated technologies to construct project-specific solutions tailored to the unique requirements and needs of each use case (e.g. development of AI modules, custom electronics, custom robotics etc.). AI and custom robotics allow interaction with different environments, cases, and domains, by utilizing, for example, MATT’s technology to offer testing services for HMIs and devices with touchscreens and/or buttons. Apart from the industries where MATT and ERIS activate in, custom robotics allows the team to interact with different cases and domains: in real estate tech & IoT custom developed smart hotel & smart office solutions; developing health monitoring bracelets dedicated to elders’ assistance. This diversity of environments allowed us to also work on scenarios requiring NFC & RFID.

Sniffer Robotics is a robotics company that develops and manufactures products to manage methane emissions from landfills.

The world has realized the negative environmental impact of methane emissions and is now embracing the need to identify and mitigate them. Sniffer Robotics has developed an advanced solution helpful in accomplishing this objective. The solution, referred to as the SnifferDRONE™, is an unmanned aerial system (UAS) featuring a drone integrated with Sniffer developed and patented technology.  The SnifferDRONE collects a corpus of methane concentration (PPM) data at the ground surface, with location coordinates, in an efficient and effective manner. The information that results provides accurate and comprehensive methane leak locations and emission quantification. Though the SnifferDRONE was initially developed for the municipal solid waste (MSW) landfill market (the third-largest source of human-related methane emissions in the US according to the EPA), it is also applicable for other land-based applications found in the renewable natural gas, mining, and other markets. Because of the SnifferDRONE’s ability to locate more leak locations, MSW sites are also successfully using the system to aid in the reduction of landfill odors. Sniffer is a “Technology as a Service” company utilizing advanced technologies and solutions to collect, analyze, and inform for action. The company offers a wide range of aerial (drone-based) services, field services, and is a provider and developer of Esri GIS mapping and spatial analytical software solutions. We endeavor to deliver clear and concise information through advanced tools and solutions, that engages and excites our clients to act.

AlterEcho develops remote embodiment robotics enabling life science professionals to perform aseptic work from outside cleanrooms or hazardous zones. Using VR headsets and motion controllers, operators control robot arms in sealed chambers with full dexterity and 3D vision - safely distant from contamination and biohazards. Unlike laboratory hoods, glove boxes and isolators exposing humans and limiting throughput, AlterEcho eliminates human presence in critical processes, achieving true Class A (EU-GMP Annex 1) sterility while maintaining flexibility for complex tasks. Our platform integrates robotics with AI assistance, supporting delicate procedures with complete control and traceability. For laboratory hoods, AlterEcho offers plug-and-play upgrades to remote operation. In pharmaceutical manufacturing, we replace glove-based isolators with robotics chambers keeping staff outside sterile zones. Our vision: compact robotics containers piloted by skilled professionals and enhanced by adaptive AI. This defines life sciences' future: relying on human mind, not body. Physically demanding tasks become precision robot piloting - eliminating fatigue and injury, making roles accessible to a more diverse workforce as markets evolve. AlterEcho serves pharmaceutical manufacturers in aseptic processing including injectables and Class A cleanroom workflows. Our technology benefits specialty labs in radiopharma, infectious disease, and vaccine R&D where biohazard handling is critical. Vexnor Technology is a biotechnology firm that develops artificial electromechanical muscle actuators for exoskeletons and humanoid robots.
Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA), Middle East, Middle East and North Africa (MENA)

Vexnor Technology is a deep-tech startup developing patent-pending biomimetic electromechanical actuator systems inspired by the contraction dynamics of real muscle fibers. Our artificial muscle technology, rooted in sarcomere-like behavior, offers a compact, silent, and energy-efficient alternative to traditional actuation methods like pneumatics and servo motors.  We target applications in wearable robotics, exoskeletons, and humanoid robots—delivering scalable, modular solutions for industries ranging from healthcare and rehabilitation to industrial ergonomics. Our flagship technology is currently at TRL 4 and supported by national and international patents (PCT, USPTO).  Vexnor has secured equity-based public funding through the TUBITAK 1812 Investment Program, a joint initiative by TUBITAK and the Türkiye Development Fund, and received additional support from KOSGEB. The company was awarded during its pre-incubation phase from Manisa Teknokent and received the TUBIAK "Seal of Excellence", validating the project’s scientific, technical, and commercial merit.  With mentoring from Sabancı University’s SUCool program, Vexnor successfully transitioned into an incorporated company. It is also backed by a strong advisory board and academic collaborations.  Our business model includes B2B actuator sales, licensing of our proprietary Magneruca core technology, and vertical product lines like the Myospine wearable solution. We aim to pioneer the next generation of human-machine interfaces and artificial muscle platforms—accelerating the roadmap through upcoming investment and public funding, with the goal of global deployment by 2026. Keywords: Biomimetic Actuators, Wearable Robotics, Exoskeleton Technology, Artificial Muscles, Human-Machine Integration, Assistive Robotics, Industrial Ergonomics, Electromechanical Systems, HealthTech, DeepTech, Biomechanics, Robotics R&D, MedTech

1) What we do • We develop a deep learning based QA(Question Answer) system that understands the true intention of the question and provide a Unique Correct Answer 2) Why • AI based Smart machines are penetrating into our everyday lives, there are signals of paradigm shift from the traditional web search system to QA system. 3) Market Size  • Globally expecting a $50bn market size by year 2025 (+50% YoY). • 50% of all searches will be done by voice searches by year 2020. 4) Technology  • We have core technologies in IR(Information Retrieval), Triple, MRC(Machine Reading Comprehension), Paraphrasing, NLU/NLP(Natural Language Understanding/Processing) etc. 5) Core Competency  • Our system is different to the existing system because we have a high accuracy, self expansion of KB(knowledge base), low GPU cost, quick response. • This is the reason why we have the globally the first deep learning based QA commercial version in Korean. • We have experience in a commercial version of sematic search which has similar logics with QA system and also have multi-language web-search experience as well. • Strong team with CEO having +20yrs of related work experience. 6) Target Markets  • Connected Cars, Smart Speakers, Home IoT, Home Robots, Smart Toys, Personal Assistants, Chatbot Apps, Intranet, KMS. 7) Business Model  • Planning B2C penetration through B2B2C Alliance and set for global expansion with multi-language support. 8) References  • B2B projects with some major TELCOs in Korea, such as LG and Korea Telecom, and also with big ship building industries and financial institutions. 9) Competitors • Competitors have QA systems based on either Rule-based or Inference based which has limitations on commercialization. 10) Team  • CEO: Pioneer in the search engine industry with +20 years of experiences, deep learning expert • Total member of 27 (22 QA specialists) (hiring currently more)

CapSen Robotics provides software to identify, scan, and track the 3D positions and orientations of specific objects in cluttered scenes.

From the shelves of a warehouse to your kitchen sink, the real world is full of clutter. At CapSen Robotics, their goal is to provide a universal 3D computer vision system which enables computers to understand the physical world in all of its cluttered glory. Robots and computer vision systems are slowly making their way out of the factory and into less structured environments such as hospitals, warehouses, farms, and homes. Although recent advances are quite impressive, these systems are still limited in their ability to understand what they see and must be carefully programmed to get the bare minimum of information out of their sensory data in order to accomplish their assigned tasks. Their goal at CapSen Robotics is to change this—they have developed a suite of computer vision solutions based on new research from MIT on 3D object detection in cluttered scenes. This is a foundational technology that will have broad impact on a wide range of consumer, industrial, and defense markets, from computer gaming and augmented reality to logistics, manufacturing, and robotics. They are beta testing with system integrators like The Proud Company and robotics companies like IAM Robotics on robotic picking applications, and are partnering with a top 5 government contractor on a non-robotic warehouse application for a large Fortune 100 distributor. One of the robots using their object detection software at MIT recently took part in a robotic order fulfillment competition sponsored by Amazon and took 2nd place out of 31 teams.

Skyeton is a developer of fully automated UAS systems combating worldwide problems.

We are a bootstrap tech startup. We were founded by a group of dedicated aviation engineers in 2006. After developing and selling more than 100 ultralight sports aircraft, the company developed a high-performance unmanned aerial system, Raybird 3. Raybird 3 is a fully autonomous airborne robot system. Independent journalists adjudicated our flight endurance at 24.5 hours with a carburetor engine. Recently, we adopted fuel injection that extends our flight endurance beyond 30 hours, uninterrupted/day & night. Our LTM revenue as of May 2020 was $3.3M, and we are profitable. We developed 80% of our 48 subsystems, which gives us agility and flexibility to provide tailored turnkey solutions to our customers' needs reliably. https://fire-in.eu/en listed our solution as civilian use for early wildfire detection. We already held meetings with France, Spain, & Greece and gained tractions with the US Dept. of Interiors. We just don't sell systems; we also provide Drone(Data)-as-a-Service business model to enterprises who may have limited use of our system on a yearly basis. We owned several patents, of which one of them approved in May 2020 by US PTO. We have several unique custom solutions built on AI/Computer Vision. One of them is to work in tandem with First Responders in early wildfire detections. We can scan 10,000 sq. Km every 12 hours. The moment the drone detects a hotspot as small as 6x3 feet from 2,700 feet above the ground, it goes back to the location to take pictures. Images then is transmitted to the Ground Control Station so the Operator can dispatch the First Responder to the site. We also provide Geodesy certified mapping of large areas. We are a UAV swarm minded company and have many exciting projects in the pipeline that will continue to shatter new grounds. We are disrupting terrestrial & piloted flying systems, data collection, detection, and mapping businesses.

Sensetics develops tactile sensing and haptic technologies that enable the digital capture and reproduction of touch.

Sensetics develops tactile sensing and haptic technologies that enable the digital capture and reproduction of touch. Its core product, Touch Signature, is a programmable fabric that integrates soft piezoelectrics and microscale 3D metamaterials to simulate human mechanoreceptors. This technology allows for sub-millimeter resolution touch sensing and haptic feedback, facilitating real-time interaction between users and machines. Sensetics combines this hardware with AI-powered software to analyze and interpret physical contact, supporting applications in remote operations, robotics, and human-machine interfaces. The company's solutions aim to bring touch into the digital realm, enabling bidirectional, interactive experiences between humans and machines.

Duckietown is a platform for AI and robotics teaching, training, and research center.

Duckietowns is a learning ecosystem for state-of-the-art robot autonomy science and technology. It offers teaching, learning, and research solutions to higher education instructors, companies, research laboratories, and "makademics" (makers with an academic spirit). Duckietown includes hardware (model self-driving cars, modular smart city, quadcopters), pedagogical materials (curricula, theory, exercises, activities, slides, etc.), simulation, operation manuals, a development environment, a research-grade evaluation infrastructure, open source autonomy code and access to an international community of instructors and learners. The Duckietown platform is also being used for massive remote online teaching and learning, with a MOOC hosted on the edX platform, and in the AI Driving Olympics, to test the state of the art of embodied AI on self-driving cars.
